display_title.display_title:
Côte d’Ivoire – Deuxième projet
            forestier : Côte d’Ivoire - Deuxième Projet forestier

subtopic: Forests and Forestry,Wetlands,Wood Manufacturing and Industry,Forestry,Environmental Economics & Policies

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Forestry
            Project for the Ivory Coast was unsatisfactory. The project
            did not achieve many of its objectives, institutional
            development was negligible, sustainability is unlikely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was less than
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, industrial plantations have a part to play
            in a balanced strategy for the development of the sector but
            their establishment and maintenance will not be enough to
            address the full gamut of social and environmental issues
            that are implicated in forest depletion. In general,
            forestry projects need to be broader in conception. Second,
            the private sector should be involved in the sustainable
            management of logging concessions. Finally, in designing
            plantation projects, every attempt should be made to ensure
            that funding arrangements will permit adequate maintenance
            and fire protection.
